item.title: Big Boat Battle
item.description:
This my top-down combat game where you pilot a toy boat against waves of enemy ships within a foggy pool! Some interesting features include:

  • Volumetric Fog, which can be parted by objects which attenuate the fog density
  • Procedural Water with Ripples using render textures and a wave shader
  • Render texture scrolling to follow the player across a potentially infinite map
  • Boid NPC behaviors to create enemy ship formations
  • Procedural behavior generation for enemies, with possible states depending on assigned tasks and enemy type
  • Procedural enemies, with varying coloration, decoration, and armaments based on enemy types
  • A variety of ships procedurally modelled in Houdini
In-game prototyping Houdini modelling

Demo Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPxqBuK4olA

item.title: Catanks
item.description:
Catanks is UPGRADE’s 2024–2025 semester project, released on Steam as a top-down arcade tank shooter where you battle the numerous NPC rat tanks. As producer and one of 2 lead developers, I worked closely with 10+ programmers and coordinated the game’s asset and production pipelines.

I was responsible for most of the core game design planning and game mechanics programming during the first half of development, before shifting my focus to developing the Classic Mode inspired by Wii Tanks during the second half. This included implementing advanced enemy AI and pathfinding systems using state machines and bullet-dodging behaviors to give the players a meaningful challenge.

item.title: Mechanika
item.description:
This 2D rhythm-oriented bullet hell was my first Unity game, and I was one of two programmers in a group of five people. Although the game may have been a bit overscoped, being an amalgamation of the ideas of all 5 of us, I am pretty satisfied with how the game turned out.

I was responsible for game design and map layouts, and I implemented the NPC enemies, including the two super-difficult rhythm-oriented bosses. It was here where I’d say I fell in love with game design and ignited my passion for programming NPC behaviors.

item.title: VR Cricothyrotomy Simulator
item.description: As part of Penn Medicine through the PURM summer research internship, I developed a VR surgical airway trainer in Unity for Unity for Meta Quest 2, 3, and Pro headsets. A cricothyrotomy is a critical emergency airway procedure performed when conventional methods fail. Due to the rarity of such cases, hands-on experience is extremely limited. This VR simulator module addresses this issue, with the aim of being used alongside conventional medical education by improving procedural familiarity in a safe, repeatable environment.
